title: Stereochemistry in Chemistry
description: Flashcards on stereochemistry in chemistry with 8 question-answer sets at the 11th-grade level.

questions.question: What is stereochemistry?
questions.answer: Stereochemistry is the study of the three-dimensional arrangement of atoms in molecules and the effect of this arrangement on chemical reactions.

questions.question: What is a stereoisomer?
questions.answer: Stereoisomers are compounds with the same molecular formula and connectivity but different spatial arrangements of atoms.

questions.question: What is a chiral molecule?
questions.answer: A chiral molecule is a molecule that is not superimposable on its mirror image and has at least one chiral center.

questions.question: What is an enantiomer?
questions.answer: Enantiomers are non-superimposable mirror images of each other.

questions.question: What is chirality?
questions.answer: Chirality is a geometric property of a molecule resulting from its inability to be superimposed on its mirror image.

questions.question: What is a chiral center?
questions.answer: A chiral center is an atom in a molecule that is bonded to four different atoms or groups, leading to chirality.

questions.question: What is a meso compound?
questions.answer: A meso compound is a molecule with chiral centers that also has an internal plane of symmetry, making it optically inactive.

questions.question: What is optical activity?
questions.answer: Optical activity is the ability of a substance to rotate the plane of polarized light.
